title: Robotic Weeder
summary: Autonomous robotic weeder using Raspberry Pi and filtering algorithm to reduce labor costs for small organic farms. Awarded 1st in Mechanical Engineering at Georgia Tech Spring 2025 Capstone Expo.

title: Pool Shooting Robot
summary: Automated billiards cut-shot robot using 3D printed rack-and-pinion system, ESP-32 camera, and YOLOv11 model with 99% accuracy; V2 under development.

title: SpaceX Intern Project
summary: Automated Starlink dish transfer system with pneumatic actuators and high-speed vacuum gantry; achieved 2000 units/hr throughput with zero failures in 50k cycles.

title: Tesla Intern Project
summary: Created an automated 4K imaging system for drivetrain components and designed a new differential housing; uploads images to a custom web server.

title: Zipline Intern Project
summary: Designed injection-molded parts and assembly fixtures for drone electrical systems; optimized for flight, thermal, and safety requirements.

title: 6-DOF Arm Kinematics
summary: Simulated Mitsubishi PA-10C arm with inverse kinematics and collision avoidance for neuroendoscopy paths in MATLAB.

title: Tendon Driven Guidewires
summary: Developed tendon attachment methods for guidewires with knots, epoxy, and laser-cut micro plates; achieved 2× required pulling force.

title: Custom Drone and Flight Controller
summary: Built a $300 drone with custom ESP-8266 flight controller, 3D-printed components, and object-tracking for automated flight and landing.

title: Boston Scientific Intern Project
summary: Optimized catheter sensor manufacturing with custom fixtures and DOEs; improved throughput 10× and reduced scrap 80%.

title: Wearable Stethoscope
summary: Developed wearable stethoscopes for COPD and CVD detection; fabricated nano-devices and applied MATLAB signal processing.

title: ME 2110 Class Robot
summary: Constructed a task-performing robot for ME 2110 with 3D-printed and laser-cut parts; programmed autonomous operations in Arduino IDE.

title: FIRST FTC Robotics - Ultimate Goal
summary: Designed and programmed FTC Ultimate Goal robot using odometry and OpenCV for autonomous ring placement; reached World Championships.

title: FIRST FTC Robotics - Skystone
summary: Developed FTC Skystone robot with passthrough intake and dual lift for block stacking; reached World Championships.

title: Tracking Microscope
summary: Designed a $300 tracking microscope with OpenCV-based organism tracking; first-author peer-reviewed paper.

title: FIRST FTC Robotics - Rover Ruckus
summary: Built multi-object intake for FTC robot using Solidworks and 3D printing to optimize scoring.
